text.content:
NURSING ADMISSION ASSESSMENT

ADVANCE DIRECTIVE:

The patient does not have an advance directive.
  Does the patient want assistance to complete an advance directive?
ADMISSION INFORMATION
Patient was admitted on 7/9/13 at 15:00 via stretcher 
to Observation bed 1.

Patient identification is confirmed by an accurate secured armband
   YES

VITAL SIGNS ON ADMISSION -----------------------------------------------------

            B/P:  131/71 (07/09/2013 17:52)
          Pulse:  92 (07/09/2013 17:52)
    Temperature:  100.7 F [38.2 C] (07/09/2013 17:52)
   Respirations:  14 (07/09/2013 17:52)
         Weight:  231 lb [105.0 kg] (07/03/2013 15:13)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2012 16:31)
            BMI:  40
           Pain:  5 (07/09/2013 17:52)



   Date and time of last food/fluid intake: July 9, 2013@0730 
BELONGINGS -------------------------------------------------------------------
   Patient kept the following items: n/a
   Other belongings kept by the patient:   cell phone. 
   Patients belongings bagged and sent to:  home
   Belongings form signed. Yes
   Agent cashier/AOD notified to collect valuables? N/A 
   Patient has own medications with them? no
   Did the patient take own medications this AM? Yes
   Patient instructed that all medications will be administered by nursing 
staff.

Patient arrived with the MEDICATION RECONCILIATION Questionnaire? 
   Yes - reinforced with the patient to complete the form and review it with 
their provider.

ORIENTATION TO UNIT ----------------------------------------------------------
   Patient was oriented to: ID band placed, bed/controls, overhead lights, 
telephone, TV, call light, shower/tub, meal time, unit routines, visiting 
hours, smoking policy

CONTACT AND LEGAL INFORMATION ------------------------------------------------
   Did you get a copy of your Rights/Responsibilities? 
   EMERGENCY CONTACT/Phone numbers: 303-555-6677

           Relationship of contact: sister Cprs, Seven
           HOME Phone Number:  303-555-6677 
 
   Does patient have a Medical Durable Power of Attorney? no 
   Does patient have a LEGAL GUARDIAN who makes legal decisions? no 
 
 
   Does the patient have an ADVANCE DIRECTIVE? no 
   Is there a copy of the Advance Directive on the patient's chart? No 
   If no, where is it located? 


==============================================================================
CHIEF COMPLAINT/PRESENTING PROBLEM: abdominal pain, fever

    Allergies: see postings box for allergens and reactions.

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS ============================================================

   MENTATION
   Alert and oriented to person, place and time
      Other elopement risk factors present? 
   NEUROLOGICAL
   History of neurological problems?  no 
 
   CARDIOVASCULAR 
   History of cardiovascular problems?  Yes: 
   hypertension
   Comments: 

     IV in place: 
     Type: Peripheral IV 
     Size: 18
     Location: L AC 
     Date placed: July 9, 2013 @ 10:30
   Do you have any Implanted ports/Tunneled catheters/Dialysis access or other 
   venous access?  No 
   Do you have a subcutaneous line used with an Insulin pump? No 
   Describe: 


   RESPIRATORY
   History of respiratory problems? no


   GASTROINTESTINAL
   History of stomach or bowel problems?  no

   Last BM:  July 8, 2013

   GENITOURINARY
   History of kidney or bladder problems?  Patient denies. 
 
   Comments: 

   MUSCULOSKELETAL
   History of musculoskeletal problems? no


   ENDOCRINE 
   History of endocrine problems? 
   hypothyroid
   Comments: synthroid

   MENTAL HEALTH
   History of emotional/behavioral difficulties?  Yes: Depression
 
   Comments: VENLAFAXINE


   WOMENS' HEALTH
   History of gynecological problems? no
 
   Pregnant? no
   Last menstrual period: post-menopausal
   Comments: 

==============================================================================
   PREVIOUS SURGERIES? Yes:  thyroidectomy 2002


   Hardware Present? Patient denies. 
 

   PREVIOUS HOSPITILIZATIONS?:  no
   Comments: 


   PHYSICAL RESTRICTIONS:  no
   Describe: 

 
   TOBACCO HISTORY 
   Chews? No 
   Smokes? quit 
      If patient stopped smoking, when, and for how long? since 2002
 
      Smoking history:  1/2 pk per day for 12 years.
   Patient has received information on No Smoking policy and nicotine 
replacement options
   Tobacco Cessation Counseling:
      Patient counseled about tobacco cessation
      pt not interested in stopping smoking. wants to quit alcohol

   Does the Veteran have COGNITIVE DEFICITS that would interfere with his/her 
   ability to understand the smoke free policy?  No 


   Does the Veteran have a HISTORY of violating smoking rules, unsafe smoking 
   practices, or burns caused by smoking?  No 

   Patient has surrendered all smoking materials

============================================================================== 
SCREENS 

   PAIN ASSESSMENT 

   WILDCATS - all areas MUST be completed for any reports of pain
      Patient Words describing pain OR pain behaviors Observed:
         constant stabbing pain
      Intensity (0 no pain 10 worst possible) 6
      Pain behaviors mild, moderate, severe : moderate
 
      Location(s): Abd/flank
 
      Duration: today
 
      Patient's Comfort Goal: 0
 
      Aggravating/Alleviating Factors: movement increasea pain
 
      Treatments (Drug and Non Drug, Past & Present, & Beliefs):none
 
      Symptoms and Side Effects of pain and pain treatments:
 
   Patient given copy of the leaflet, "Managing Your Pain"
 
 

==============================================================================
   NUTRITION SCREEN

     Patient reports UNPLANNED weight change in the last 3 months?  No
       If Yes:      Number of pounds: 
 
       Other: 
   **If any of the above are checked send a DIETETIC Consult.
 
    No needs identified.

   ORAL SCREEN
   July 9,2013 @ 17:45
 
           Patient/Resident:  Has own natural teeth

 ALCOHOL SCREEN ==============================================================
 

   Patient HAS NOT used alcohol in the past year. 

 1. How often did you have a drink containing alcohol in the past year?
     Monthly or less
 2. How many drinks containing alcohol did you have on a typical day when you 
were drinking in the past year?
     0 drinks
 3. How often did you have six or more drinks on one occasion in the past year?
     Never 
 
   Patient's Physician was notified.   n/a


   RECREATIONAL DRUGS  =======================================================
   Do you use recreational drugs? No 
   Comments: 

   ABUSE/NEGLECT SCREEN ======================================================
   Based on your review and observations are there signs/symptoms of potential 
   Abuse/Neglect? No
   If yes check all of the following that apply and NOTIFY THE PATIENT'S 
   PHYSICIAN 
 
   *Site, extent, type, number of injuries: N/A 
 


   SOCIAL WORK SCREEN ========================================================
 
   Other: 
 
    **If any of the above are checked send a consult to SOCIAL WORK for patients
    on Medical or Surgical Services.
 
   No needs identified.
 

   CULTURAL SCREEN ===========================================================
   Do you want visitors restricted? No 
 
   Describe: 


   PASTORAL CARE SCREEN ======================================================
   Is spiritual care important to you as part of your healthcare? No 
 
   Are there religious practices or spiritual concerns, of which 
   you want your physician and health care team to be aware?      No 
     ** If the answer to either question is "yes" send consult to Pastoral Care.

MOBILITY SCREEN =============================================================

   In the last month the patient has had new onset of, or worsening of: 
Morse scale 45


**If any of the above are checked send a PM&RS Consult.
 
FALL RISK SCREEN =============================================
 
   - Patient Level of Assistance:
    Independent performs task safely, with or without assistive devices.
   - Can patient bear weight? 

   - Does the patient have upper extremity strength needed to support his/her 
   weight during transfers? 

   MORSE FALL RISK SCALE
 

      History of Falls   0 No
      Secondary Dx      15 Yes
      Ambulatory Aid     0 None/ Bedrest/ Nurse assist
      IV/Hep Lock       20 Yes 
      Gait/Transfer     10 Weak
      Mental Status      0 Oriented to own ability
         TOTAL SCORE:   45

FALL RISK SCORE ASSESSMENT ===================================================
Total score indicates low risk
 

==============================================================================
      EDUCATION of patient and/or caregiver: about fall risks, about 
interventions being used by staff
Fall Prevention Brochure given to veteran and/or family member, discussed, and 
verbalized understanding. 

==============================================================================
==============================================================================


Admission MRSA swab completed.
  General education was provided to this patient about the MRSA screening of 
    all patients?  Yes
  The patient was informed that the MRSA initiative includes the screening of 
    all patients by swabing their nose and taking additional precautions to 
    prevent the transmission of MRSA in the facility?  Yes
  MRSA handouts were given?  Yes

==============================================================================
PATIENT EDUCATION
   BARRIERS TO LEARNING
   Patient:  No observed barriers to learning 
   Comments: 
   Family/Significant Other:  No observed barriers to learning
   Comments: 
   INFORMATION GIVEN: plan of care

   Information was given to Patient 
   Method of instruction - verbal 
   Motivation -  Appears interested, Asks questions, Eager to learn
   Learner response: Indicates Understanding 
   Comments:
Were any abnormalities observed on the following screens? 
 
Nutrition: No
Dysphagia: No
Alcohol:  No
Abuse/Neglect:  No
Social work needs:  No
Mobility screen:  No 
Fall risk (Morse > 60): No
text.author: AVIVAUSER,TWENTYNINE
